SourcedStatement: Given the county’s long history of white flight and segregation, its oldest neighborhoods are primarily — other than Midtown — occupied by Black and brown residents.
Name: U.S. Census Bureau
Justification: about 96% of residents are Black, and about 91% of homes were built prior to 1978, according to the U.S. Census Bureau.

SourcedStatement: The map below shows which Memphis ZIPs contain the most homes built before 1980, according to Census data.
Name: U.S. Census Bureau
